item.title: ChemSciPicks paper is online

item.title: Publication
item.description: Publications Pham, L. N.; Walsh, T. Design traits for diblock copolymer coating properties on NaGdF4 upconversion nanoparticles. ACS Appl. Polym. Mater 2022 (accepted) Pham, L. N.; Walsh, T. Predicting Biomolecule Adsorption on MoS2 Nanosheets with High Structural Fidelity. Chem. Sci. 2022, 13, 5186-5195. doi:10.1039/D1SC06814H (Chem Sci Pick of the Week). Pham, L. N.; Walsh, T. R. Force Fields for Water–Surface Interaction: Is Reproduction of the Experimental Water Contact Angle Enough?

item.title: Research
item.description: I. Research of interests 2D nanomaterials and biological materials Molecular dynamics force field development Semiconductor clusters doped with transition metals Transition metal oxide magnetic materials II. Programing 1. A simple Hartree-Fock program written in Python 3 In an attempt to learn programming, I have created a small program written in Python 3, which can solve the Schr√∂dinger equation for HHe+ at the Hartree-Fock level. If you are interested in Python programming and basic quantum chemical theory, just have a look at it (on Github).

item.title: MoSu-CHARMM Force Field
item.description:
Here we introduce data used for development of MoSu-CHARMM and notices for usage of MoSu-CHARMM
Data used for fitting MoSu-CHARMM force field

This depository (Github) contains all crystal structure files (CIF) of several optimized adsorption configurations used to calculate fitting and validation datasets of energy which were employed to fit and validate the MoSu-CHARMM. All adsorption energies in these two data sets can be found in the spreadsheet (Excel file).

item.title: Chem Sci Pick of the Week
item.description:
I'm thrilled to announce that my @ChemicalScience paper coauthored by Prof. Tiffany Walsh at @DeakinIfm has been selected as Chem Sci Pick of the Week. It will be published in a special collection soon. Stay tuned!
üçª pic.twitter.com/Jqg4xZ0FWT

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) March 18, 2022

item.title: MoSu-CHARMM force field in Chemical Science
item.description:
Very excited to share my recently accepted manuscript in @ChemicalScience. A new high-fidelity force field for MD description of interaction between 2D MoS2 and organic materials including peptides and proteins.https://t.co/sR8Lqzcxhi

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) March 16, 2022

item.title: Chemical communiation paper
item.description:
Our recently accepted paper in @ChemCommun proposes a novel criterion and then a new protocol for assessment and development of interfacial force fields. Very excited to share it here.

https://t.co/9OD4VZeXQO

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) March 1, 2021

item.title: About
item.description:
LE NHAN PHAM

I am a chemist whose research experience is related to physical & theoretical chemistry and materials, particularly atomic clusters, excited states, and currently 2D&biological and polymer materials. I graduated (Ph.D.) from Department of Chemistry, University of Leuven, Belgium (September 2019), and is currently working as a postdoctoral research fellow at Deakin University. After PhD graduation from KU Leuven, I joined the Russo Group (Department of Physics, RMIT, Australia) as a visiting scholar for short time. I was also a yearly-contract lecturer at Department of Chemistry, University of Dalat, Vietnam.
